description.narrative: The project development objective (PDO) is to improve the quality and timeliness of public financial management information in support of the Government’s PFM Reform Action Plan (PFMRAP) to improve budget execution.

condition.narrative: Finance Agreement :Counterpart Funding | Description :The Recipient shall provide in its FY 14/15 budget, adequate funds to carryout specific activities as contained in Schedule 2 Section IV (C) of the Financing Agreement | Due Date :31-Mar-2015

title.narrative: 1. Improved reliablity of in-year budget execution reports from IFMIS

baseline.value: In-year budget execution reports from IFMIS are generally considered not to be reliable, due to lack of bank accountsreconciliations and no month-end closing of the IFMIS.

target.value: In-year budget execution reports from the upgraded IFMIS have no material concerns regarding data reliability, since month-endclosures are operational and TSA bank reconciliations are done monthly.

actual.value: In-year budget execution reports are available in the upgraded IFMIS. Reliability of information in these reports are supported byreconciling the transactions recorded in new TSA revenue and expenditure bank accounts in the upgraded IFMIS with the transactiondetail recorded by the CBL. Although month-end instructions have been issued to line ministries, the closing procedures in theupgraded IFMIS still need to be initiated.

title.narrative: 4. New Treasury Single Account (TSA) bank balances in the IFMIS

baseline.value: No new TSA balances are available in the IFMIS.

target.value: New TSA bank accounts are operational and carried forward into the upgraded IFMIS.

actual.value: New TSA recurrent and development expenditure bank accounts have been opened at the CBL and in the IFMIS. They are being reconciledon a monthly basis.

title.narrative: 4. Line ministry revenue transactions not captured in the IFMIS

baseline.value: Non-tax revenues collected by line ministries are not routinely captured in the IFMIS, and there is ineffective monitoring atTreasury to ensure that this happens.

target.value: Non-tax revenue transactions are recorded reliably in the IFMIS, supported by timely bank reconciliations.

actual.value: The upgraded IFMIS has been configured for line ministries to issue online receipts. Transaction processing has not yet beeninitiated, since the revenue budget still needs to be uploaded and receipt printers have not yet been installed.

title.narrative: 3. Stock of expenditure arrears available in IFMIS

baseline.value: There is no IFMIS data on the stock of expenditure arrears.

target.value: Stock of expenditure arrears is available online in the upgraded IFMIS.

actual.value: The upgraded IFMIS provides reports on invoices recorded but not yet paid. MoF also collected data on all outstanding invoices byend of March 2019, and are recording these for payment in the upgraded IFMIS.

title.narrative: 2. Improved timeliness and completeness of annual financial statements

baseline.value: Three-year backlog in the preparation of annual financial statements - 2008/09, 2009/10, and 2010/11. IFMIS data to support annualfinancial statements for budgetary central government lacks balances for financial assets and financial liabilities.

target.value: The FY2018/19 annual financial statements for budgetary central government under preparation and contain data from the upgradedIFMIS on all financial assets and financial liabilities.

actual.value: Government eradicated the backlog of annual financial statements, and the consolidated annual financial statements for 2017/2018were submitted within the legal timeframe to the Office of the Auditor-general. The 2018/19 annual financial statements are underpreparation, for audit submission by 31 August 2019. The upgraded IFMIS has not yet been configured to control and report on publicdebt transactions.

baseline.value: Business process review to support configuration of the new version of IFMIS contracted by not yet started

target.value: Business process review to support configuration of the new version of IFMIS completed

actual.value: Business process review to support configuration of the new version of IFMIS completed.

baseline.value: Change management plan not yet developed

actual.value: Change management and training plan substantially implemented.

baseline.value: End-user equipment to operate upgraded IFMIS not yet procured

target.value: End-user equipment upgraded to work on new IFMIS

actual.value: End-user equipment has been upgraded to work on the new IFMIS.

title.narrative: 9. Initial operational acceptance of the upgraded IFMIS

baseline.value: IFMIS upgrade contracted but not yet started

target.value: Initial operational acceptance of the upgraded IFMIS achieved

actual.value: The upgraded IFMIS has been substantially configured and is in operation.

baseline.value: Servers for new upgraded version of IFMIS not yet procured

target.value: Servers for new upgraded version of IFMIS operational

actual.value: The upgraded IFMIS operates on new servers.
